com.nobigsoftware.dfalex

Class Pattern

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.nobigsoftware.dfalex.Pattern
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CharRange

    public abstract class Pattern
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    A Pattern represents a set of strings. A string in the set is said to "match" the pattern.

    Methods are provided here for building up patterns from smaller ones, like regular expressions.

    In DFALex, the only requirement for a pattern is that it can add itself to an Nfa so we can make matchers with it.

    See Also:
    Serialized Form

        public static final Pattern DECIMAL
        A FLOAT_DECIMAL or an INTEGER. Anything this matches is valid for Double.parseDouble(String), if the value fits

      • range

        public static Pattern range(char from,
                            char to)
        Create a pattern that matches all single characters with a range of values

        The pattern will match a character c if from <= c <= to.

        Parameters:
        from - inclusive lower bound
        to - inclusive upper bound
        Returns:
        the pattern that matches the range

      • addToNFA

        public abstract int addToNFA(Nfa<?> nfa,
                             int targetState)
        Add the pattern to an NFA

        New states will be created in the NFA to match the pattern and transition to the given targetState.

        NO NEW TRANSITIONS will be added to the target state or any other pre-existing state

        Parameters:
        nfa - nfa to add to
        targetState - target state after the pattern is matched
        Returns:
        a state that transitions to targetState after matching the pattern, and only after matching the pattern. This may be targetState if the pattern is an empty string.

      • matchesEmpty

        public abstract boolean matchesEmpty()
        Returns:
        true if this pattern matches the empty string
